Key Match Events: Lane Thomas had four RBIs on a pair of infield singles with two outs when Cleveland runners on second and third were in motion and able to race home.
Steven Kwan had two hits and scored twice.
Sosa and Ramos each had two hits for Chicago.
Davis Martin (0-4) yielded five runs on six hits in three innings.
Post-Match Reflections: First-year Cleveland manager Stephen Vogt felt incredible about the victory, praising the team's performance and baserunning.
Lane Thomas expressed satisfaction with his recent performance and plans to continue building off his success.
Chicago White Sox manager said the team is closing in on the post-1900 record for losses, with 120 losses by the 1962 New York Mets in their inaugural season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cleveland Guardians finished 6-3 on a three-city trip that included stops in Kansas City and at Dodger Stadium in Los Angeles.
Chicago White Sox dropped a franchise-record 15th straight at home and lost its 17th in 19 overall, sweeping for the 24th time.
